bullets.text: Fed announces enhancements to bank supervision, signaling tighter oversight and potential higher compliance costs for large banks.
Meta defeats FTC antitrust case tied to Instagram and WhatsApp, clearing path for Big Tech M&A and startup acquisitions.
Anthropic valued near $350B after Microsoft/Nvidia deal as leaders warn of LLM bubble; AI funding remains one-way.
Cloudflare outage caused widespread internet disruption, traced to a latent bug, highlighting infrastructure concentration risk across major platforms.
Bitcoin ETF posts record outflows as crypto sell-off deepens; bitcoin briefly fell below $90,000, erasing 2025 gains.
Congress approves bill to release Epstein files; heightened political risk as Trump attacks media licenses amid looming disclosures.
Trump administration moves to dismantle Education Department, foreshadowing policy shifts for K‑12, higher education and federal student aid.
Trump embraces Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, dismisses Khashoggi killing; signals U.S.-Saudi reset with business-heavy outreach.
Trump reportedly authorizes CIA covert action plans in Venezuela, elevating geopolitical risk in oil-producing nation.
U.S. backs $1 billion loan to restart Three Mile Island reactor, boosting nuclear power’s role in grid reliability and data center demand.
Target and Walmart earnings highlight bifurcated consumer: value-focused spending strength, discretionary softness, pressuring mid-tier retailers.
Home Depot cuts outlook as home improvement demand weakens, signaling softer housing-related spending.
Toyota invests $912 million to expand U.S. hybrid production, doubling down as EV demand cools.
Congressional cuts to NIH and NSF in 2025 threaten biomedical research capacity and long-term innovation.
